title: Japanese apparel firms give new life to their old clothes
summary: Japanese fashion companies are increasingly making efforts to reduce waste by reselling used clothes and recycling materials from old items. Sanyo Shokai collects used clothes from customers and resells them after checking the fabric for any frays or discoloration and ironing the items. Uniqlo is also reselling used clothes, initially on a trial basis, and recycling materials from old items.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes efforts by Japanese fashion companies to reduce waste by reselling used clothes and recycling materials from old items, which contributes to environmental sustainability goals such as reducing resource consumption and promoting a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes a new or improved business process for collecting, checking, ironing, and reselling used clothes that differs significantly from the firm's previous business processes.
green_product: TRUE, the article describes the reselling of used clothes, which can be considered a green product because it reduces waste and promotes a circular economy.
green_process: TRUE, the article describes a new or improved business process for collecting, checking, ironing, and reselling used clothes that differs significantly from the firm's previous business processes and that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by reducing waste.
